fix(filter-panel): do not rewrite panel header on filter select (#9601)

### Related Ticket(s)

Resolves #9600 

### Description

The filter panel heading was previously being overridden by a default string, "Filter", when a user selected any filter item within the panel. These changes preserve the heading value entered in the `<dds-filter-panel-heading>` component.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12532727/198349963-3368f071-cb50-46e4-88a2-2254dfbce0ca.mov

### Changelog

**Changed**

- Preserves filter panel heading text when any filter items are selected.

issue.title: fix(masthead): avoid inline styles for CSP compliance

labels.name: RTL
labels.description: Assigned to Arabic Right to Left work

labels.name: package: web components
labels.description: Work necessary for the IBM.com Library web components package

issue.body:
## Related Ticket(s)

Closes #9599 

## Description

Due to the content-security-policy header, browsers will begin to [block inline scripts and styles](https://content-security-policy.com/examples/allow-inline-style/). To keep the masthead's `<top-nav>` component usable when the number of items would over flow the container, we need a way to handle offset styles _dynamically_ without using inline styles or regular `<style>` elements on the page.

This PR adds a new mixin that creates a `<style>` element with the necessary `nonce` attribute, if available. The mixin provides the below functionality

### On ConnectedCallback

When the component connects, it checks `window.nonce` for the nonce string for this exact pageload, and stores it as `this._nonce` for later use

### Render functions

Components implmenting this mixin should _not_ have their own render function, but should instead use the abstract `renderContents()` method. This mixin renders the dynamic stylesheet along with the returned template from renderContents(). If a component _must_ implement `render()`, it must also run `renderDynamicStyles()` within that render function.

### Style getter/setter methods

- `setStyleBySelector(selectorString, styleProperty, styleValue) { ... }`
  "upserts" a style rule, either creating it for the first time or overriding the style for the given selector
  
- `getStyleBySelector(selectorString, styleProperty) { ... }`

### The Stylesheet

The rendered `<style>` element will not update it's contents, but because we're using CSSOM methods, the styles _do_ apply, and they _do_ cause change on the page. Users should never attempt to set `innerHTML` of the element, as that will cause the element to "reset" and discard all programatic changes made using the setter method above.



### Changelog

**Changed**

- Moved DDSTopNav inline styles to an adoptedStylesheet

issue.title: chore(search): allow option to stop redirection with enter
issue.body:
### Related Ticket(s)
#9374

### Description
The Search with Typeahead component will now be dispatching an event upon the user hitting the enter key right before being redirected to the search results page. This is done to encompass all possible redirections coming from the component, in order for any adopters to intercept and stop the redirection if desired.

Due to the fact that the component uses a `form`, pressing enter within will always activate the redirection no matter what, using the `action` attribute, unless using an event listener to stop it.

### Changelog

**New**

- `dds-search-with-typeahead-beingredirected` being fired upon hitting enter now

issue.title: fix(masthead): avoid inline styles for CSP compliance

labels.name: RTL
labels.description: Assigned to Arabic Right to Left work

labels.name: package: web components
labels.description: Work necessary for the IBM.com Library web components package

issue.body:
### Related Ticket(s)

Closes #9599 

### Description

Due to the content-security-policy header, browsers will begin to [block inline scripts and styles](https://content-security-policy.com/examples/allow-inline-style/). To keep the masthead's `<top-nav>` component usable when the number of items would over flow the container, we need a way to handle offset styles _dynamically_ without using inline styles or `<style>` elements on the page.

Components defined by lit-element obviously have styles defined somewhere, but they don't have `<style>` elements in the shadow root, ~and are in fact using the [adoptedStylesheets property](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ShadowRoot/adoptedStyleSheets) of their shadowRoots.~

~By defining a new stylesheet and controlling the exact order and contents of the CSSRules, we should be able to update the values in compliance with the CSP.~

As it turns out, `shadowRoot.adoptedStylesheets` are not supported in safari, which is instead implementing `shadowRoot.styleSheets`. To avoid writing browser-specific code and fighting with the TS errors that accompany those non-standard properties, I've changed tactics.

Now, the `<dds-top-nav>` component is utilizing a new mixin, `CspComplianceMixin`, which on `connectedCallback` checks for both a global `window.nonce` string and a style element that accompanies that nonce string. If no style element is found, one is created. Then, with a standard implementation of the CSSOM for stylesheets, rulelists, and rules, we can store & retrieve variables there to use statically in our scss files. The warning below still applies

> **Warning**
> This method is only usable in this case because the stylesheet adopted by the `<dds-top-nav>` is _only_ used by _this_ `<dds-top-nav>`. The static styles are applied equally to every instance of the component created by that constructor. If we need to move future inline styles out of component markup on a per-instance basis, _this is not the solution_.

### Changelog

**Changed**

- Moved DDSTopNav inline styles to an adoptedStylesheet

fix(video-player): prevent minuscule thumbnails (#9583)

### Related Ticket(s)

Resolves #9365 

### Description

The default width for `DDSVideoPlayer` thumbnails seems to have been accidentally set to `3px`, resulting in tiny images that appeared as a blur when stretched to fill the container. I've reset this default width to `655px`, the size they were before the accidental change.

While debugging, I noticed the `tabs-extended-media` Storybook story was not rendering videos. I fixed this by adding a missing import to the `content-item-horizontal/index.ts` file.

### Changelog

**Changed**

- Restores the default width for video player thumbnails to a sensible size (`655px`).
- Fixes video rendering when using `content-item-horizontal` component.

release.name: v1.40.0-rc0
release.body:
## Web Components (v.1.25.0-rc.0)
### Features
- **content-item-horizontal**
  - update spacing and add media option to default (#9475)
- **cta-block**
  - react wrapper (#9408)

### Fixes
- **text-cta**
  - add visually-hidden helper text (#9461)
- **storybook**
  - improve feature flags granularity (#9568)
  - react/wc experimental (#9450)
  - dotcomshell/lightbox missing imports (#9426)
- **masthead**
  - pass logo data from endpoint json to composite (#9462) (#9465)
  - remove aria-haspopup from profile menu for vo (#9562)
  - remove unnecessary aria-label (#9480)
- **storybook-react-wrapper**
  - props not appearing (#9571)
- **tabs-extended-media**
  - fix improper logic in story (#9564)
- **image**

issue.title: fix(masthead): avoid inline styles for CSP compliance

labels.name: RTL
labels.description: Assigned to Arabic Right to Left work

labels.name: package: web components
labels.description: Work necessary for the IBM.com Library web components package

issue.body:
## Related Ticket(s)

Closes #9599 

## Description

Due to the content-security-policy header, browsers will begin to [block inline scripts and styles](https://content-security-policy.com/examples/allow-inline-style/). To keep the masthead's `<top-nav>` component usable when the number of items would over flow the container, we need a way to handle offset styles _dynamically_ without using inline styles or regular `<style>` elements on the page.

This PR adds a new mixin that creates a `<style>` element with the necessary `nonce` attribute, if available. The mixin provides the below functionality

### On ConnectedCallback

When the component connects, it checks `window.nonce` for the nonce string for this exact pageload, and stores it as `this._nonce` for later use

### Render functions

Components implmenting this mixin should _not_ have their own render function, but should instead use the abstract `renderContents()` method. This mixin renders the dynamic stylesheet along with the returned template from renderContents(). If a component _must_ implement `render()`, it must also run `renderDynamicStyles()` within that render function.

### Style getter/setter methods

- `setStyleBySelector(selectorString, styleProperty, styleValue) { ... }`
  "upserts" a style rule, either creating it for the first time or overriding the style for the given selector
  
- `getStyleBySelector(selectorString, styleProperty) { ... }`

### The Stylesheet

The rendered `<style>` element will not update it's contents, but because we're using CSSOM methods, the styles _do_ apply, and they _do_ cause change on the page. Users should never attempt to set `innerHTML` of the element, as that will cause the element to "reset" and discard all programatic changes made using the setter method above.



### Changelog

**Changed**

- Moved DDSTopNav inline styles to an adoptedStylesheet

issue.title: chore(search): allow option to stop redirection with enter
issue.body:
### Related Ticket(s)
#9374

### Description
The Search with Typeahead component will now be dispatching an event upon the user hitting the enter key right before being redirected to the search results page. This is done to encompass all possible redirections coming from the component, in order for any adopters to intercept and stop the redirection if desired.

Due to the fact that the component uses a `form`, pressing enter within will always activate the redirection no matter what, using the `action` attribute, unless using an event listener to stop it.

### Changelog

**New**

- `dds-search-with-typeahead-beingredirected` being fired upon hitting enter now

Components defined by lit-element obviously have styles defined somewhere, but they don't have `<style>` elements in the shadow root, ~and are in fact using the [adoptedStylesheets property](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ShadowRoot/adoptedStyleSheets) of their shadowRoots.~

~By defining a new stylesheet and controlling the exact order and contents of the CSSRules, we should be able to update the values in compliance with the CSP.~

As it turns out, `shadowRoot.adoptedStylesheets` are not supported in safari, which is instead implementing `shadowRoot.styleSheets`. To avoid writing browser-specific code and fighting with the TS errors that accompany those non-standard properties, I've changed tactics.

Now, the `<dds-top-nav>` component is utilizing a new mixin, `CspComplianceMixin`, which on `connectedCallback` checks for both a global `window.nonce` string and a style element that accompanies that nonce string. If no style element is found, one is created. Then, with a standard implementation of the CSSOM for stylesheets, rulelists, and rules, we can store & retrieve variables there to use statically in our scss files. The warning below still applies

> **Warning**
> This method is only usable in this case because the stylesheet adopted by the `<dds-top-nav>` is _only_ used by _this_ `<dds-top-nav>`. The static styles are applied equally to every instance of the component created by that constructor. If we need to move future inline styles out of component markup on a per-instance basis, _this is not the solution_.

### Changelog

**Changed**

- Moved DDSTopNav inline styles to an adoptedStylesheet

fix(video-player): prevent minuscule thumbnails (#9583)

### Related Ticket(s)

Resolves #9365 

### Description

The default width for `DDSVideoPlayer` thumbnails seems to have been accidentally set to `3px`, resulting in tiny images that appeared as a blur when stretched to fill the container. I've reset this default width to `655px`, the size they were before the accidental change.

While debugging, I noticed the `tabs-extended-media` Storybook story was not rendering videos. I fixed this by adding a missing import to the `content-item-horizontal/index.ts` file.

### Changelog

**Changed**

- Restores the default width for video player thumbnails to a sensible size (`655px`).
- Fixes video rendering when using `content-item-horizontal` component.

issue.title: fix(masthead): avoid inline styles for CSP compliance

labels.name: RTL
labels.description: Assigned to Arabic Right to Left work

labels.name: package: web components
labels.description: Work necessary for the IBM.com Library web components package

issue.body:
## Related Ticket(s)

Closes #9599 

## Description

Due to the content-security-policy header, browsers will begin to [block inline scripts and styles](https://content-security-policy.com/examples/allow-inline-style/). To keep the masthead's `<top-nav>` component usable when the number of items would over flow the container, we need a way to handle offset styles _dynamically_ without using inline styles or regular `<style>` elements on the page.

This PR adds a new mixin that creates a `<style>` element with the necessary `nonce` attribute, if available. The mixin provides the below functionality

### On ConnectedCallback

When the component connects, it checks `window.nonce` for the nonce string for this exact pageload, and stores it as `this._nonce` for later use

### Render functions

Components implmenting this mixin should _not_ have their own render function, but should instead use the abstract `renderContents()` method. This mixin renders the dynamic stylesheet along with the returned template from renderContents(). If a component _must_ implement `render()`, it must also run `renderDynamicStyles()` within that render function.

### Style getter/setter methods

- `setStyleBySelector(selectorString, styleProperty, styleValue) { ... }`
  "upserts" a style rule, either creating it for the first time or overriding the style for the given selector
  
- `getStyleBySelector(selectorString, styleProperty) { ... }`

### The Stylesheet

The rendered `<style>` element will not update it's contents, but because we're using CSSOM methods, the styles _do_ apply, and they _do_ cause change on the page. Users should never attempt to set `innerHTML` of the element, as that will cause the element to "reset" and discard all programatic changes made using the setter method above.



### Changelog

**Changed**

- Moved DDSTopNav inline styles to an adoptedStylesheet

### Related Ticket(s)
#9374

### Description
The Search with Typeahead component will now be dispatching an event upon the user hitting the enter key right before being redirected to the search results page. This is done to encompass all possible redirections coming from the component, in order for any adopters to intercept and stop the redirection if desired.

Due to the fact that the component uses a `form`, pressing enter within will always activate the redirection no matter what, using the `action` attribute, unless using an event listener to stop it.

### Changelog

**New**

- `dds-search-with-typeahead-beingredirected` being fired upon hitting enter now

issue.title: fix(masthead): avoid inline styles for CSP compliance

labels.name: RTL
labels.description: Assigned to Arabic Right to Left work

labels.name: package: web components
labels.description: Work necessary for the IBM.com Library web components package

issue.body:
### Related Ticket(s)

Closes #9599 

### Description

Due to the content-security-policy header, browsers will begin to [block inline scripts and styles](https://content-security-policy.com/examples/allow-inline-style/). To keep the masthead's `<top-nav>` component usable when the number of items would over flow the container, we need a way to handle offset styles _dynamically_ without using inline styles or `<style>` elements on the page.

Components defined by lit-element obviously have styles defined somewhere, but they don't have `<style>` elements in the shadow root, ~and are in fact using the [adoptedStylesheets property](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ShadowRoot/adoptedStyleSheets) of their shadowRoots.~

~By defining a new stylesheet and controlling the exact order and contents of the CSSRules, we should be able to update the values in compliance with the CSP.~

As it turns out, `shadowRoot.adoptedStylesheets` are not supported in safari, which is instead implementing `shadowRoot.styleSheets`. To avoid writing browser-specific code and fighting with the TS errors that accompany those non-standard properties, I've changed tactics.

Now, the `<dds-top-nav>` component is utilizing a new mixin, `CspComplianceMixin`, which on `connectedCallback` checks for both a global `window.nonce` string and a style element that accompanies that nonce string. If no style element is found, one is created. Then, with a standard implementation of the CSSOM for stylesheets, rulelists, and rules, we can store & retrieve variables there to use statically in our scss files. The warning below still applies

> **Warning**
> This method is only usable in this case because the stylesheet adopted by the `<dds-top-nav>` is _only_ used by _this_ `<dds-top-nav>`. The static styles are applied equally to every instance of the component created by that constructor. If we need to move future inline styles out of component markup on a per-instance basis, _this is not the solution_.

### Changelog

**Changed**

- Moved DDSTopNav inline styles to an adoptedStylesheet

<!-- To enable additional available deploy previews, apply the following -->
<!-- labels for the corresponding package: -->

issue.body:
### Related Ticket(s)

[ADCMS-2489](https://jsw.ibm.com/browse/ADCMS-2489)

### Description

Fixes a bug in the contentObserverCallback that would erroneously remove elements from the `_targets` property by only scraping one slot

### Changelog

**Changed**

- modified contentObserverCallback logix
- runs contentObserverCallback on change to `name` and `data-title` attributes in assigned nodes & their subtrees

fix(video-player): prevent minuscule thumbnails (#9583)

### Related Ticket(s)

Resolves #9365 

### Description

The default width for `DDSVideoPlayer` thumbnails seems to have been accidentally set to `3px`, resulting in tiny images that appeared as a blur when stretched to fill the container. I've reset this default width to `655px`, the size they were before the accidental change.

While debugging, I noticed the `tabs-extended-media` Storybook story was not rendering videos. I fixed this by adding a missing import to the `content-item-horizontal/index.ts` file.

### Changelog

**Changed**

- Restores the default width for video player thumbnails to a sensible size (`655px`).
- Fixes video rendering when using `content-item-horizontal` component.

release.name: v1.40.0-rc0
release.body:
## Web Components (v.1.25.0-rc.0)
### Features
- **content-item-horizontal**
  - update spacing and add media option to default (#9475)
- **cta-block**
  - react wrapper (#9408)

### Fixes
- **text-cta**
  - add visually-hidden helper text (#9461)
- **storybook**
  - improve feature flags granularity (#9568)
  - react/wc experimental (#9450)
  - dotcomshell/lightbox missing imports (#9426)
- **masthead**
  - pass logo data from endpoint json to composite (#9462) (#9465)
  - remove aria-haspopup from profile menu for vo (#9562)
  - remove unnecessary aria-label (#9480)
- **storybook-react-wrapper**
  - props not appearing (#9571)
- **tabs-extended-media**
  - fix improper logic in story (#9564)
- **image**
  - add image caption to aria-describedby attribute (#9446)
- **feature-section**
  - react wrapper img alt not being used in story (#9476)
- **expressive-modal**
  - add role and aria-level to expressive-modal-heading for screenreader (#9451)
- **masthead-logo**
  - accessibility issues with tabindex (#9419)
- **filter-panel-input-select**
  - aria expanded (#9435)

### Housekeeping
- **upgrade**
  - upgrade to carbon 10.58.4 (#9482)
  - upgrade to carbon 10.58.3 (#9432)
- **masthead**
  - update e2e storybook tests (#9467)

## React
### Features
- **content-item-horizontal**
  - update spacing and add media option to default (#9475)

### Fixes
- **text-cta**
  - add visually-hidden helper text (#9461)
- **storybook**
  - improve feature flags granularity (#9568)
  - react/wc experimental (#9450)
- **a11y**
  - allow localized labels for rewind/forward/caption buttons (#9452)
- **videoplayer**
  - pass custom caption to lightboxmediaviewer (#9458)
- **react**
  - storybook experimental/rtl gh-pages (#9455)
- **mastheadleftnav**
  - trap focus to mobile masthead on vo (#9454)
- **localemodal**
  - assign focus on modal close to avoid focus being stuck on vo (#9449)
- **notice-choice**
  - update callback functions (#9421)

### Housekeeping
- **upgrade**
  - upgrade to carbon 10.58.4 (#9482)
  - upgrade to carbon 10.58.3 (#9432)

## Styles
### Features
- **content-item-horizontal**
  - update spacing and add media option to default (#9475)

### Fixes
- **styles**
  - tabs-extended-media responsive styles (#9554)
- **mastheadleftnav**
  - trap focus to mobile masthead on vo (#9454)
- **content-block**
  - fix cta alignment for mobile viewport (#9453)

### Housekeeping
- **upgrade**
  - upgrade to carbon 10.58.4 (#9482)
  - upgrade to carbon 10.58.3 (#9432)

## Services Store
### Fixes
- **masthead**
  - pass logo data from endpoint json to composite (#9462) (#9465)

## Utilities
### Fixes
- **deps**
  - update dependency isomorphic-dompurify to v0.23.0 (#9470)

### Housekeeping
- **settings**
  - update settings to v1.40.0
- **upgrade**
  - upgrade to carbon 10.58.4 (#9482)
  - upgrade to carbon 10.58.3 (#9432)
